hints:
Use ARROW KEYS or
WASD to walk.
Press SPACE, Z or J to jump.

Press Ctrl, X, K
or  to attack.

Press Shift, C, L
or  to shoot.

Press DOWN to crouch and then
JUMP to high jump.

Hold down the ATTACK button
to CHARGE a power attack.

Hit bricks with your head
to break them.

Press DOWN + ATTACK after
jumping to do a down attack.

Hold down the SHOOT button
to CHARGE a power shot.
hints_gamepad:
Use DPAD or LEFT STICK
to walk.

Press DOWN to crouch and then
JUMP to high jump.

Hold down the ATTACK button
to CHARGE a power attack.

Hit bricks with your head
to break them.

Press DOWN + ATTACK after
jumping to do a down attack.

Hold down the SHOOT button
to CHARGE a power shot.
healthup:
It contains some sweet, sweet
vitality! It increases your
maximum health.
ammoup: You obtain a BOX OF BULLETS!

Now you can carry more bul-
lets. Somehow.
dreamorb:
It emits dreamlike energy. Who
knows what it does!
purchase:
Purchase this item?
It costs you %1.
shopdescription1:
Slightly increases your
melee attack power.

Makes your bullets do
more damage.

You need a %1 KEY to

You open the door with

You need more dreams orbs to
open this door.

You open the huge door leading
to the Old Graveyard.
lick:
Lick the Eye? (I know
you want to!)

You pull a lever and suddenly
it feels like there are
fewer magical beams in

cutscene0:
When the world was dying
they needed someone to
dream them a better
world.

So they created the Great
Dreamer, whose only
purpose was to dream a
ew world.

She dreamed a perfect utopia
for them, but one day she
started to question her own
creation.

They sealed her spirit away
so she could not destroy
what she had created.

But now, the seal is
broken...
cutscene1:
The new world was called
the World of Dream,
or simply "The Dream".

It was reserved for those
who had wealth and power.

It makes you wonder, what
happened to the real world?
cutscene2:
Lady Alexandra, that was
the name of the Great
Dreamer when she was
still a human.

She was chosen to be the
Great Dreamer because of
her outstanding ability
to dream worlds.
Or that is what they claimed.
cutscene3:
When Lady Alexandra was
sealed away, there was
no one left to supervise
the Dream.

The Dream started to decay,
and people inhabiting it
vanished or were turned
into monsters.

It seems that the scientists
who had created the Great
Dreamer did not understand
how the dreams work.

How can there be a dream
if there is no dreamer...?
cutscene4:
Running the Dream requires an
enormous amount of energy
and resources. It is,
after all, a world
inside another world.

Thus, creating the Dream
only accelerated the
desctruction of the
real world

If the real world dies,
so does the World
of Dream.

Unless, of course, someone
stops the Dream...
cutscene5:
Lady Alexandra has a
recurring nightmare,
where a giant eye was
chasing her.

They say that the eye
belongs to her father.

A man who sacrificed here own
daughter to create an
utopia for rich and
powerful.
cutscene6:
Lord Dankworth was the
leading engineer of
the "Project Dream". It
was his lifework. Obsession,
even.

Rumors say that he knew
that the brain scan could
kill his daughter.

But still he let the
scientists scan Lady
Alexandra's brain, which
resulted in her death.
cutscene7:
Each time Lady Alexandra
had a nightmare, she
would dream a hero
who banishes the bad
dream.

He shares a strong
resemblance with her
little brother, who
was killed in a fatal
accident.
npc0:
We are the keepers of
the Graveyard. Our
job is to bury dreams
that come here to die.

However, the Great
Dreamer told us to dig
you up and give you a
life. For what reason,
we do not know.

It has been centuries
since she talked to
us last time. You
must be very precious
to her.
npc1:
These portals connect
different parts of
the Dream together.
Some of them are
one-way only, though.
npc2:
Welcome, stranger, to
the World of Dream!
We don't get visitors
from the Graveyard
too often.

You must be the one
the Great Dreamer
has summoned. She is
waiting for you...
somewhere.

Here whereabouts are
unknown to us, I'm
afraid.
npc3:
Did you know there is
also the Old Graveyard?
Nowadays we only
bury nightmares
there.

Not all nightmares
remain dead, though.
Pray you never need
to go there.
npc4:
In the old times we hid
Dream Orbs around the
island. They were
stored in chests like
the one above us.

If you could gather
eight of them, you
won a special audience
with the Great Dreamer
herself.

This was when the old
citizens were still
alive...
npc5:
The Great Dreamer was
unable to dream proper
houses, so she gave
us these..."containers"
instead.

This one used to belong
to the woodcutter, but
then he vanished, like
all the other old
citizens.

Now this house is inha-
bitated by the shop-
keeper.
npc6:
This part of the Dream
is now long forgotten,
hence we call it the
'Forgotten Coast'.

There used to be a port
here. People could
sail to the smaller
islands in the Dream.

Most of these island sunk
soon after the
Great Dreamer's spi-
rit was sealed away.
npc7:
There are many broken
portals in this island.
They used to connect
the Dream to the outer
worlds.

I think this particular
portal used to take
you to the Inner
Dream.
npc8:
The Great Dreamer loves
puzzles, so she created
us islands fulls of
puzzles so we could
'train our brains'.

This is the only island
that hasn't sunken yet.
She is not very good
at making islands...

You can reset the
puzzle by leaving and
re-entering this place.
npc9:
There used to be many
people living down
here. Some people
just prefer caves
to actual houses.
npc10:
This passage used to
lead to the sewers,
but some time ago
it collapsed and water
rushed in.

I never understood why
we needed sewers: we
do not produce any
waste here, this is
a utopia!
npc11:
We are not people.
We are more like...
Ghosts? Spirits?
Memories of the past,
perhaps.

That's why you can
find us standing in
weird places.
npc12:
For a long while we
did not need a grave-
yard. You were not
supposed to die in
a dream!

Then the Great Dreamer
was sealed away, and
things started to happen.

First we buried people
on this hill, then
to the Old Grave-
yard.

In fact, the portal
above should take
you to the Old
Graveyard, but you
need to pay a toll.
npc13:
All those monsters
outside used to be
citizens of the Dream.

Don't feel bad if you
have to kill them,
though: they can
no longer feel
anything.
npc14:
Long time ago Lady
Alexandra dreamed of
a nuclear war. It
might have been a
nightmare.

Anyways, when it was
over we thought
we had better build
a shelter. Just
in case.
npc15:
NO MATTER WHAT THEY
SAY, I AM NOT
INSANE! THE NIGHT-
MARES DO NOT AFFECT
MY PSYCHE AT ALL!

And that's because I
don't even have a
psyche.
npc16:
The Eye is possibly
the greatest night-
mare the Great
Dreamer ever had.

When The Eye came here,
we built him this
beautiful tomb.

If you go inside, you
might get a sudden
urge to lick The
Eye.

But whatever you do,
NEVER LICK THE EYE!
Because it is gross.
item0:
It reminds you of your child-
hood. What a dummy you were!
item1:
It is a trusty (or was it rus-
ty?) old sword for all types
of unjustified violence.
item2:
It is one of those novelty
firearms where you put your
hand inside. Not very practi-
cal, but looks cool.
item3:
Its magical capabilities allow
you to breathe underwater,
making it possible to dive
without fear or dying.
item4:
You obtain a PAIR OF SPRING
BOOTS!

They are just ordinary leather
boots, but they have springs
in the bottom, allowing you
to perform a high jump!
Hooray!
item5:
This magical flames makes
possible to perform a power-
ful charge attack. Because
that's what magic fires
do.
item6:
Knowing that it this key only
opens red doors makes you
see red.
item7:
Not opening a blue door with
this key makes you feel blue.
item8:
It reminds you of the face of
your dying grandmother.
Better use it only to open
purple doors!
item9:
All this sudden negativity
gives you motivation to
learn a down attack.
item10:
You obtain a RECHARGABLE BAT-
TERY!

Now you can store some energy
plasma thing in your gun and
release it as a powerful
charge attack!
